c74object.name: fl.gaussian~
c74object.digest: Generates frames of normally distributed random values
c74object.description: Mean and standard deviation can be set per sample or by parameter. Per-sample mean and standard deviations are passed in by input. The length of the output is dependent on the mode parameter. Output length may be set by parameter or based on that of the trigger input. When input and output lengths are mismatched the result depends on the mismatch parameter.

entry.name: /mode [enum]
entry.description:
Controls how the output length is determined:
[0] - requested - the output length is set by the length parameter.[1] - input - the output length follows the length of the trigger input.
(default: requested)

entry.name: /length [int]
entry.description:
Sets the requested output length in the units specified by the units parameter.
(default: 1)

entry.name: /units [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the units used for the length parameter.
[0] - samples[1] - ms[2] - seconds
(default: samples)

entry.name: /mismatch [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the mode used when dealing with mismatches between input and output lengths:
[0] - default - missing input values are substitued using the default values.[1] - extend - inputs are extended by repeating their final value.
Note that default values are always used when an input is empty.
(default: default)

objarg.name: mode
objarg.digest: Controls how the output length is determined
objarg.description:
This argument sets the mode parameter:
Controls how the output length is determined:
[0] - requested - the output length is set by the length parameter.[1] - input - the output length follows the length of the trigger input.
(default: requested)

objarg.name: length
objarg.digest: Sets the requested output length in the units specified by the units parameter
objarg.description:
This argument sets the length parameter:
Sets the requested output length in the units specified by the units parameter.
(default: 1)

objarg.name: units
objarg.digest: Sets the units used for the length parameter
objarg.description:
This argument sets the units parameter:
Sets the units used for the length parameter.
[0] - samples[1] - ms[2] - seconds
(default: samples)

objarg.name: mean
objarg.description:
This argument sets the mean parameter:
Sets the default mean.
(default: 0)

objarg.name: deviation
objarg.description:
This argument sets the deviation parameter:
Sets the default standard deviation.
(default: 1)

objarg.name: mismatch
objarg.digest: Sets the mode used when dealing with mismatches between input and output lengths
objarg.description:
This argument sets the mismatch parameter:
Sets the mode used when dealing with mismatches between input and output lengths:
[0] - default - missing input values are substitued using the default values.[1] - extend - inputs are extended by repeating their final value.
Note that default values are always used when an input is empty.
(default: default)

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.gaussian~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.gaussian~. When set to 0 fl.gaussian~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.gaussian~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
